description.title: brake circuit : precautions for the repair

descmetadata.siename: brake circuit : precautions for the repair

description.title: Advice to be followed before any operation

descbody.para: For an operation requiring the use of a lift, follow the safety advice vehicle : towing and liftingGIEMR-002447.
The brake regulation circuit must be free of all hydraulic and electrical faults.
In case of incorrect handling, the brake fluid can cause serious injury and damage. Follow the manufacturer's instructions for brake fluid.
To prevent dust from entering the master cylinder reservoir and the brake circuit, the plug must be removed just before filling and closed immediately afterwards,

description.title: Instructions to be followed during the operation

descbody.para: Do not press on the brake pedal during work on the brake system.
If, during work on the brake system, any damage on any part is observed, it must be repaired before driving the vehicle again.
Brake fluid is highly corrosive. Ensure any brake fluid spilt on parts of the vehicle is cleaned off.
Use brake fluids that comply with the Renault standardvehicle: parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445.
Check the brake fluid levels in the braking circuit and the bleeding device.
Check that the bleeding device pressure is between 1.5 bar and 2 bar .

description.title: Advice to be followed before any operation

descbody.para: Protect any bodywork components that risk being damaged by brake fluid with a cover.

description.title: Instructions to be followed during the operation

descbody.para: Fit blanking plugs recommended for the Siemens K9K injection system at the end of each pipe and in all the openings of the disconnected components of the brake circuit.
Clean around the braking system using brake cleaner vehicle: parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445.
Check the condition of the threads and ensure there are no foreign bodies on them when refitting the components.

noteR.para: Prepare for the flow of fluid, and protect the surrounding components.

descbody.para: Do not allow friction materials to come into contact with grease, oil or other lubricants and cleaning products which are mineral oil based.
When replacing brake pads, always replace the pads on the other side as well.
When replacing a disc, always replace the disc on the opposite side.
When replacing brake discs, you must replace the brake pads.

noteR.para: In order not to damage the brake hose:

ul.li: check that there is no contact with the surrounding components, regardless of the position of the wheels.

noteR.para: To avoid any accident, bring the pistons, brake pads and brake discs into contact by depressing the brake pad several times.

ul.li: The pipes between the master cylinder, callipers and the hydraulic assembly are connected using threaded unions with a metric thread.
Therefore, only parts specified in the Parts Catalogue for this vehicle should be used.
shape of steel or copper pipe end piece (A),
shape of connecting points on components (B),
shape of unions (C): six 11 mm outer sides.

descsection.para: Precautions to be taken before and during the brake circuit bleeding operation:

ul.li: use brake fluid that complies with the Renault standard vehicle: parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445,
check the brake fluid levels in the brake circuit and the bleeding device,
the braking regulation circuit must be free from all hydraulic and electrical faults,
check that the bleeding device pressure is between 1.5 bar and 2 bar .
